p: The most cited plants in this study were Warburgia salutaris, Zanthoxylum gilletii, Carissa edulis, Tylosema fassoglensis, and Harrisonia abyssinica. Carissa edulis and Clerodendrum myricoides have been reported to be useful in the management of asthma, cough, and cold [ 37, 105]. The similarity of our observations to those made by previous authors seems to suggest that there may in fact be a consensus among herbalists from different communities with regard to the usefulness of some of the medicinal plants in their environment.
